result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell M Wrycha

records.addlTxt:
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:15 PM Defendant Russell M Wrycha in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Russell M Wrycha.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Jambois states appearances.

Matter is set for a waived preliminary hearing.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:16 PM Defendant Russell M Wrycha appeared by video, not able to get his video working in an inpatient treatment facility.   Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Russell M Wrycha.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Defendant did request to appear remotely prior to today's hearing.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant is informed he needs to appear in person or have his attorney request for him to appear remotely.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Request to Appear Remotely. Filed by Atty Bergner. Forwarded to JA.

BY THE COURT:
